column4: Is there a way to mv files matching a regex pattern while recursively going through a directory tree?
thanks, is there any way I can make mv take the source_file direct from standard input?
you mean the mv from the find command?
I can use find to locate the paths of all the files I want to move, but is there a way to pipe them directly accross as source_file_paths for mv to use?
the {} is a way to replace the results
are you sure that commands right, I get the error "find: unknown predicate `-dir'"
use an absolute path on your destination folder for the move
if you want a move relative to your result folder, use -execdir
